intro: Ranunculus biformis, commonly known as the two-lobed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers with five to eight petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with leaves that are palmately lobed and have a distinctive, waxy appearance. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in early spring. Ranunculus biformis prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
